title: OneWeb signs contract to launch satellites from India in 2022
summary: OneWeb has signed a contract to use India’s largest launch vehicle to deploy at least some of its remaining LEO broadband satellites this year, according to a company executive.

title: DoD a main proponent of anti-satellite test ban: ‘We are not disarming’
summary: "Space related rules and norms of responsible behavior are in our interest,” said deputy assistant secretary of defense John Hill

title: NASA, Industry to Collaborate on Space Communications by 2025
summary: NASA selected six American satellite communications (SATCOM) providers on April 20 to begin developing and demonstrating near-Earth space communication services that may support future agency missions.

title: Next SpaceX crew launch on hold to wait for return of private astronaut mission
summary: The launch of a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket carrying the next astronaut crew to the International Space Station has been postponed from Saturday after weather delays in returning a team of commercial astronauts from the outpost back to Earth, NASA officials said Wednesday.

title: Astrobotic into testing of Griffin lunar lander for NASA’s Artemis program
summary: Astrobotic, a Pittsburg-based lunar lander company, has fully assembled the test model for its largest lunar lander in development, the Griffin.
